alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Hamilton; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:10PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bradley and southeastern Hamilton Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Harrison, or 11 miles northeast of Ringgold, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Ridgeside, Harrison, Wildwood Lake, South Cleveland, Collegedale, Conasauga, East Brainerd, Red Clay State Park and Flint Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
